content: I consider that the Balance is the vital principle of life. In Tamil there is a proverb: அளவுக்கு மீறினால் அமுதமும் நஞ்சாகும். That is, if it exceeds the prescribed limit, even nectar would become poison. One has to behave in a pleasant manner but he should not become a pushover. It is always good to be aware of our boundaries in all matters but we should never interfere with the freedom of others. We should remember that our right to stretch our hands ends where the other person’s nose begins. We should be frank and truthful but should never be rude, offensive and indecorous. We should not have inhibitions about the possibilities of failure but we cannot afford to be indifferent about failure. We should not be cowards but should not also be foolhardy in our actions. We should guard against negative mindset but should be able to analyse pros and cons of our proposals before committing ourselves. We should not be over excited or over exuberant; but being dispirited and enthusiastic is as bad as being hyperactive. Though over-dependence on others is bad, it is equally bad to be incapable of associating with others when necessary.
